results.title: The Funeral
results.creator_credit: October Films, Mary Kane and Abel Ferrara
results.brief_description: Working from an original screenplay from his long time collaborator Nicholas St John, Abel Ferrara’s “The Funeral” sees the maverick director working in a more low key mode. That’s not to say of course that “The Funeral” doesn’t have Ferrara’s usual trademarks; seething violence, spiritual males and cathartic redemption. The film’s melancholic study of a crime family in crisis is set off by the murder of 22 year old Johnny Tempio (Vincent Gallo), shot dead in a movie theatre by a rival gang. His grief stricken brothers (Christopher Walken and Chris Penn) vow bloody revenge, while the women (Annabella Sciorra and Isabella Rossellini) of the family look for a more peaceful resolution. Ferrara is a master of transcending conventional genres as he proved with his bold reinvention of the vampire movie in The Addiction (1995) and his rabid cop drama Bad Lieutenant (1992). Again Ferrara manages to transcend the cliches of the gangster film as the bloody quest for revenge becomes an internal affair, leaving the mafia brothers to contemplate the nature of guilt and the futility of retribution. 1996 Venice Film Festival winner for Best Supporting Actor (Chris Penn) and the OCIC (Organisation Catholique Internationale du Cinema) Award for Abel Ferrara. Cast includes: Benicio del Toro, Gretchen Mol.

results.title: The Funeral
results.creator_credit: Yasushi Tamaoki, Yutaka Okada and Juzo Itami
results.brief_description: The Funeral is a story about three days in which a married couple, an actor and an actress, must preside over a traditional, Japanese funeral for a member of the family. Their confusion, the complex demands this situation presents and the reactions of other participants create a story that is simultaneously comic, sad and moving.

results.title: The Fundamentals of tennis
results.brief_description: Donald Budge demonstrates forehand, backhand, service, volley and half-volley; the strokes are analysed and helpful suggestions for their proper execution are made. The film was sponsored by the USA Lawn Tennis Association.

results.title: The Fun of Cake Decorating a Cake for All Reasons
results.brief_description: Elaine McGregor the most celebrated name for cake decorating in English speaking countries, has demonstrated her unique powers of teaching around the world. From Australia to the United States, from Japan to the length and breadth of the UK, as well as her own Woodnutt’s School of Cake Decorating in Hove, Sussex. Elaine has imparted her great skills to thousands of enthusiastic students. Rated: G

results.title: The Fun gap
results.creator_credit: New Zealand National Film Unit, Derek Wright and John King
results.brief_description: A comprehensive look at the types of sporting activities being provided to the intellectually and physically handicapped of all ages. Special education staff and the participants themselves, including two hearing-impaired people, a young paraplegic, a blind yachtsman and some aged persons, comment on the benefits they perceive in taking part.

results.title: The Full Monty
results.creator_credit: Redwave Productions, Uberto Pasolini and Peter Cattaneo
results.brief_description:
Robert Carlyle stars as Gaz in this irreverent comedy set in the middle-England working class town of Sheffield. He is a jobless steel worker who dreams up an outrageous scheme to pull himself and his mates out of the personal and financial doldrums of long term unemployment. After seeing the money and adulation lauded upon the male exotic dance team The Chippendales by the females of the town, he rounds up willing and reticent participants for a review to be named the Full Monty. They are a collection of pigeon-chested, pot-bellied, heavy drinking, pale, wrinkly middle-aged strippers with one solitary gimmick - it all comes off!
Cast also includes: Tom Wilkinson, Mark Addy

results.title: The Fugitives = les fugitifs
results.creator_credit: Fideline Films, DD Productions, Efye Films, Orly Films, Jean-Jose Richer and Francis Veber
results.brief_description: This is the story of two men, Lucas and Pignon. Lucas is a hardened criminal, a star bank robber. Pignon is just the opposite, a nice guy with lots of problems he just cant cope with. Lucas, who has just done five years in jail, has decided to go straight. Pignon, who has just gone through three years unemployment has decided to become a crook. These two men have nothing in common. No reason to ever meet. And yet one day in a bank they do, and that is where the misadventures start. Remade in Hollywood as The Three fugitives starring Nick Nolte and Martin Short.

results.title: The Fugitive
results.brief_description: The first and last episode of the suspense-filled television series of the 1960s. The first episode “Fear in a Desert City” sets up the storyline: Dr. Richard Kimble is about to be executed for a crime he didn’t commit - the murder of his wife. He escapes and begins a desperate search for the one-armed man who may hold the key to his innocence. He is relentlessly pursued by the police. In the final episode “The Judgement” sees the final climactic confrontation between Kimble and Lieutenant Gerard, the police lieutenant who has relentlessly pursued him and the mysterious one-armed man.

results.title: The Fugitive
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Keith Barish, Arnold Kopelson and Andrew Davis
results.brief_description: The Fugitive, one of the most popular television series of the 1960’s was brought to the screen with Harrison Ford playing the role of Doctor Richard Kimble. Kimble, a Chicago surgeon, is falsely accused of murdering his wife. Convicted of the crime, he escapes from custody to pursue an unknown one-armed man, whom he knows is the killer. Hot on his trail is Sam Gerard, US Marshall, (Tommy Lee Jones), who won an Academy Award for this performance. Andrew Davis as director has created a thrilling, action-packed film which moves at a hectic pace towards the final moment when Kimble meets his man.
